meanings.definition: To prepare oneself for something difficult or challenging.
meanings.sent1: She braced herself before speaking in front of the large audience.
meanings.sent2: He always braced for impact before taking on a new project.
meanings.sent3: The little girl braced for the scary movie by hiding behind her blanket.
meanings.sent4: The team braced for the tough competition ahead, ready to give their best.
meanings.sent5: The soldier braced for battle, standing tall and determined.

meanings.sent1: The wall was braced with extra beams to make it stronger.
meanings.sent2: She braced the shelf with brackets to prevent it from falling.
meanings.sent3: The tree braced itself against the strong wind, refusing to bend.
meanings.sent4: The friendship braced them through tough times, always there for each other.
meanings.sent5: The bridge was braced by cables, ensuring its stability.

meanings.definition: A device used to support or strengthen something.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers used a metal brace to hold the structure in place.
meanings.sent2: She wore a knee brace to support her injured joint.
meanings.sent3: The bookshelf leaned to the side until they added a brace to keep it upright.
meanings.sent4: The dentist recommended a brace to align her teeth properly.
meanings.sent5: The old building needed additional braces to prevent it from collapsing.

meanings.definition: To tighten or secure with a brace.
meanings.sent1: He braced the door shut to keep the strong wind from blowing it open.
meanings.sent2: She braced the fence with wire to make sure it stayed in place.
meanings.sent3: The tent was braced with extra pegs to prevent it from flying away in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The gate was braced with a lock to secure it from intruders.
meanings.sent5: The window was braced shut during the storm to keep the rain out.
